meanings.definition: The act of placing or laying one thing over another
meanings.sent1: The superimpositions of the stickers on the notebook made it look colorful.
meanings.sent2: The artist used superimpositions of different colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent3: The superimpositions of toppings on the pizza made it look like a delicious work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her superimpositions of melodies created a beautiful harmony in the music.
meanings.sent5: The superimpositions of clouds in the sky painted a breathtaking scene.

meanings.sent1: The superimpositions of the shadows created an interesting pattern on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The superimpositions of colors in the sunset made it look magical.
meanings.sent3: The superimpositions of flavors in the dish made it a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The superimpositions of voices in the choir filled the room with harmony.
meanings.sent5: The superimpositions of leaves on the ground formed a beautiful carpet.

meanings.definition: An image or design placed on top of another image or design
meanings.sent1: The superimpositions of the logo on the advertisement made it stand out.
meanings.sent2: The superimpositions of patterns on the fabric created a unique texture.
meanings.sent3: The superimpositions of flavors in the cake made it a delightful treat.
meanings.sent4: The superimpositions of words on the page formed a meaningful poem.
meanings.sent5: The superimpositions of stars in the night sky created a mesmerizing view.
